metadata.Title: CVE-2016-5397 on Ubuntu 20.04 ESM (focal) - medium.
metadata.Description:
The Apache Thrift Go client library exposed the potential during code generation for command injection due to using an external formatting tool. Affected Apache Thrift 0.9.3 and older, Fixed in Apache Thrift 0.10.0.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-5397` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libthrift-0.13.0 - 0.13.0-2build2
libthrift-c-glib0 - 0.13.0-2build2
libthrift-perl - 0.13.0-2build2
php-thrift - 0.13.0-2build2
python3-thrift - 0.13.0-2build2
thrift-compiler - 0.13.0-2build2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: thrift package in focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '0.13.0-2build2').
